snippet: The Mall, monuments and military bases could be swamped by rising sea levels, the study says.
abstract: Research group Climate Central reports that Washington is likely to see record flooding by 2050, putting about $7 billion worth of property, three military bases and parts of the National Mall at risk as a result of climate change that is raising sea levels.
lead_paragraph: The Mall, monuments and military bases could be swamped by rising sea levels, the study says.

headline.main: Climate Report Details Flood Risk to Sites in Washington
headline.print_headline: Climate Report Details Flood Risk to Sites in Washington
